turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hi, I need to schedule an appointment with Dr. Eleanor Vance. I've been trying to call but the lines are always busy. It's getting really frustrating!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand your frustration. I can help you with that. Please provide your full name and date of birth so I can access your records. Also, could you let me know the reason for your visit and your preferred days or times for the appointment?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, my name is Sarah Peterson, date of birth January 15, 1988. It's for a follow-up on my medication. Ideally, I need something next week, perhaps Tuesday or Wednesday afternoon. The website shows nothing available then - is there *any* way to get on a cancellation list or see if Dr. Vance has *any* flexibility? It's really important I see her specifically.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thank you, Sarah. I have located your file. Regarding Dr. Vance's schedule for next week, I see the same availability as the website. While I don't have a direct cancellation list feature, I can search for the earliest available appointments and also check surrounding dates if you like. Unfortunately, appointment flexibility outside of scheduled slots is not something I can directly arrange; that would require speaking with the clinic staff or Dr. Vance's office directly. The next earliest opening I see with Dr. Vance is on Friday, two weeks from now, at 10:00 AM. Would you like me to book that, or should I look for other options?
